metadata.title: CVE-2022-35737 MITRE: CVE-2022-35737 SQLite allows an array-bounds overflow
metadata.summary: CVE-2022-35737 is a critical remote code execution vulnerability in SQLite, affecting various Microsoft products including Windows 10, Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, and CBL Mariner. The vulnerability allows for array-bounds overflow, enabling an attacker to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has addressed this by including an updated library in Windows and releasing security updates for the affected products. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The severity of this vulnerability is rated as important, and it has not been publicly exploited at the time of original publication. The assigning CNA for this CVE is MITRE Corporation on behalf of the SQLite organization. For further details and specific build numbers for the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page for CVE-2022-35737.
metadata.nvd_description: sqlite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-bounds overflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a c api.
